result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Michael Turner, through Public Defender.
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order to Withdraw.

1:37 pm -  Defendant Sheila M Dahms appeared by video.  Attorney Carl Knepel in court for Sheila M Dahms, appearing specially for Attorney Luke Harrison. Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for State of Wisconsin.  An adjournment is being requested so that Atty. Harrison can appear with his client.  Defendant waives the time limits within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Court finds good cause to waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Sheila M Dahms

Victim Identification Key.
RE:  2nd degree recklessly endangering safety-dvo, use of dangerous weapon, on 07-27-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 07-27-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 1st degree recklessly endangering safety-dvo, bail jumping, endangering safety by use of dangerous weapon and operate or going armed while under the influence of an intoxicant-dvo.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-01-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $400.00 cash with the conditions that defendant provide an address to the Clerk of Court office, in writing, within 24 hours of release, that she have no contact with J.L.M., DOB: 11-13-1974 or their residence, maintain absolute sobriety and have no possession of any weapons or firearms.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed. 
Minutes.
